data.title: 30th Anniversary Celebration at Ozzies
data.text:
Ozzie's upstairs party room is the perfect spot for friends and family to celebrate any occasion.  The buffet included clam chowder,conch chowder ( delicious when combined) smoked fish dip (very high quality), salad, chicken Alfredo, juicy tender, shrimp, garlic bread, blackened tilapia, and chicken strips, There was a choice of desserts and the lemon cake and caramel pie were to die for. 
The food was quickly replenished and was kept fresh.  Everyone raved about the food and the drink service was top notch.  I would highly recommend Ozzies for any celebration.

data.title: Excellent Fish Sandwich & Oysters. Interesting and Colorful Style.
data.text:
I was in on November 1st for lunch and it was really good. I had a fried fish sandwich that was fresh and tasty and way bigger than the bun. It was a pleasant challenge to eat it like a sandwich. The coating on the fish was crispy and just the right thickness. Sandwich came with lettuce, onion, and tomato with a choice of sauces and french fries. 

I had a dozen Key West oysters that were firm and sweet and served with sliced lemon, horseradish, and assorted hot sauces.

Service was fast and friendly. Highly recommended.

I came in for lunch so I had to stick with iced-tea but the Beck's Octoberfest on draft was mighty tempting. Next time.

data.title: Great
data.text: For $10 a person,  you really can't beat it.  It was cheaper than taking the family to Cracker Barrel.  So many choices and every one there is so friendly.  We go almost every Sunday morning.

data.title: Yesssss
data.text: Took my fiancé here for his 55th birthday and let me tell you it was amazing. They were in the process of remodeling and everyone still was able to work as a team with a smile on their face.

data.title: Horrible
data.text: Keep driving and don't lock back! Ate here with my husband food below average. As we left two women attack another customer beat her I was in shock to say the least. True story now I last heard after I was there owner maybe deferent but I'm not sure.

data.title: Ozzie's Crabhouse
data.text: I used to live in Winter Park and traveled over for business to Radiation Inc. which became Harris Corp. I discovered the crabhouse. This is my first trip back in some time, the food and atmosphere are still good.

data.title: Ozzies's forgot how to cook Crabs
data.text:
We used to go to the old Ozzie's many years ago and were sad to see it go. So when we came up from South Florida  and found out that there was a new Ozzie's we were excited. Reading all the mediocre reviews here on TA, I thought to myself "C'mon, how bad can it be? They can't mess up the crabs? Can they?"

Yes, they can and they did! We got there on a rather quiet Sunday evening and were promptly seated and waited on by Alec, who was very good. They had a special of $ 10.00 off their Dozen of Jimmy's and I ordered them half Maryland style, half Garlic. My BF ordered a rare Prime Rib. The Prime Rib came with a deep brown sauce on top of it which actually made it look overcooked. But under that sauce was a totally raw piece of meat with giant hunks of fat on it. The taste didn't resemble Prime Rib at all, rather than a raw piece of rib eye, only about half was somewhat edible. 

Now to the crabs. I started with the garlic ones. They were brownish and shriveled up. The first one tasted overcooked. The second one had a distinct taste of ammonia, so it was going bad. There was also barely any taste of garlic, no chunks, I guess they use Garlic Powder? I stopped eating them and started on the Maryland ones, those were ok.

When the server came to clear the plates I mentioned the horrible garlic crabs to him and he said he would tell the manager. He came back and said the manager was not willing to do anything about it.  He went to another manager and said that this manager would go back to the original manager to see if something could be done. but no go. The server also admitted that the Garlic Crabs are prepared in advance while the Maryland style Crabs were fresh.

What a shame....

data.title: Awesome Maryland Crabs
data.text: First time eating here. Been wanting to come check out their seafood. It was late afternoon. The place looks inviting. A bit confuse of which building to go to as the one was opened says "lounge". There were few customers. Love the inside decoration. Staff attentive. We ordered the taste basket  (gator tail, frog legs, french onion, shrimp, & mussels) - $23 and Jumbo Maryland Crabs (no price). It turned out to be $78.00. Shocked. But we should have asked before order. Not bad food. A bit hard to tell which is which on the taste basket. Some of the crab's meat a bit mushy. Welll, we satisfied our seafood craving, but definitely not going back. Not worth the long drive & $.

data.title: Sadly......not good.
data.text: Used to be good years ago before the first place burned down. Lobster and crab alfredo used to be excellent. Crabs of all kind were fresh and tasty. Have been to the new location 3 times since it has been there. First visit was confusing, so many buildings and floors?? Food was Ok to start, figured they just needed time to get their "mojo" back. 2nd visit, very poor service, food just so so and we had 6 people. So.....feeling very hopeful decided to try one more time for that good ol Ozzie's food. No and nooooo. Crab Augratin out of the freezer barely warmed. King crab 1lb special was awful. Very very small, about the size of snow crab. Shells so soft they could not be cracked, needed scissors but only had a fork. Ate in the bar which was OK due to the "other" building being renovated. I guess another fire? Well it is very sad for us Ozzie lovers. Hey service was great though! Love the atmosphere.

data.title: Local steamed and seasoned crabs
data.text: Fun place to stop by for a pan of steamed crabs and all the trimmings serviced by friendly staff and good bluegrass music.

data.title: help
data.text: this pales need help it is cut up in to little Romes unless you go out side the food is ok the price is high for what you get i just don't like it

data.title: Seafood house, NOT a crabhouse
data.text: Living in Maryland, I have yet found a "crabhouse" in Florida. Ozzie's has a good menu, but, we were there for the blue crabs....We were told only smalls and females. We were also told , smalls were 4 to 5 inches. Really, REALLY....Anything less than 5 inches is illegal in Maryland, but less than 5 could be legal here, not familiar with Florida law on size.  They said there supplier of crab has had no luck catching the bigger crab. CHANGE SUPPLIERS!!!!!  A crab house does NOT run out, or fails to supply, at least medium to large crabs. I can see having a limited supply of jumbo's and even jimmie's, but not medium and large. The menu offers many crab dishes, and the soft crab sandwich was OK.....but this is not a "crabhouse". They said when they do have the jumbo crabs in, they run about $75. If they sort by weight, and not size, after steaming, that is a good price.....I have paid a lot more for jumbo's in Maryland, and they were great crabs. With this said, I can only give Ozzie's an average rating based on a SEAFOOD HOUSE.

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: Great food and a nice atmosphere! Will definitely keep going back! Hard to please the seafood lovers in my life, but this did the trick!

data.title: Looking for lunch
data.text: I was back in Palm Bay to take care of some estate business and was looking for a quick lunch.  My sister recommended Ozzie's for a crab cake sandwich. The parking lot looked a little empty at 4 PM but I stopped anyway. When I tried to enter the restaurant I found out why...there was a fire in the kitchen the month before. The waitress told me I could eat in the bar. Not a problem as a beer would be pretty good since it was about 95 in the shade!  I did order the crab cake sandwich...and waited...and waited...a two beer wait...not a good sign.  The sandwich was average and it was served with chips.  There was only one other person in the bar while I was there. If I go back it will during the normal lunch or dinner times.

data.title: Sucks
data.text: This restaurant use to be good back in the day but now it is horrible. Food was overseasoned and my scallops were so overlooked that they were like rubber. We visited around 4-5 pm and the place smelled stale and gross.

data.title: Great food
data.text: We love Ozzie's we go every time we are in Palm Bay. Stuffed shrimp is to die for and the clam chowder is amazing, blackened Mahi is also my favorite. They have a great chef and great service. Definitely worth the drive .

data.title: Cool little spot
data.text: We really enjoyed our dinner here. We ate at the bar & the staff was friendly & attentive without being too in-your-face. The crab legs were delicious & they pour a nice drink.

data.title: great crabs
data.text: Came here for crabs, and ordered the garlic crabs.  They serve these already cleaned, and with lots of garlic.  We thoroughly enjoyed them.  Another person with us tried the crab cakes, which were ok, but seemed to have a lot of filler. Fun place to sit on the deck and eat crabs

data.title: Good food and easy fun.
data.text:
This is not a five-star fancy restaurant. I awarded five stars because of the food, atmosphere and phenomenal service. This would be an excellent feature for Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. It is just a local, hole-in-the wall that serves delicious seafood.

My wife and I dropped in on a Sunday afternoon exploring drive over to the coast.

My wife had the blackened mahi and said it was a little overdone. She used a table sauce to add a little moisture and said that it was great. I had the fries seafood platter. My fish was perfect and the shrimp was incredible. When we come back I will go straight for the shrimp platter. I also had an order of hush puppies and they were very good. I always add a smear of butter and a dollop of honey to my hush-puppies to enhance the flavor. Do not miss the cole-slaw; it has a slight vinegar flavor that is very light and refreshing.

We ate out on the upstairs porch and could hear the slight strains of the live jazz music inside. It was a great setting and all the servers were friendly and helpful. They were very busy so service was delayed; for my wife and I this just added to the charm of a relaxing and enjoyable casual dining experience. Don iscome here in a rush; come to chillax and have fun.

I cannot forget to mention our server, Angela. Although she was a rookie here at three weeks she was exceptionally, friendly, efficient and knowledgeable about the menu.

Like Arnold said, "We'll be back!"

data.title: Seafood restaurant
data.text: Our son and girlfriend were visiting from Mass. and wanted seafood. None of us had ever eaten soft shell blue crab.  The waitress was awesome and took the time to show us how.  They were very polite and personable.  We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.

owner_response.author: Alex O, Manager at Ozzie's Crabhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for stopping by and hopefully see you again 😀
owner_response.title: Owner Response
